diagnosis.final_diagnosis: POEMS syndrome with demyelinating neuropathy and solitary plasmacytoma of bone
diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: Chronic inflammatory demyelinating polyneuropathy (CIDP), Monoclonal gammopathy of undetermined significance (MGUS), Amyloidosis, Waldenström’s macroglobulinemia, Other demyelinating neuropathies
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient exhibited progressive sensory and motor symptoms, ascites, papilledema, and bone lesions. The diagnosis of POEMS syndrome was supported by the presence of polyneuropathy and a small monoclonal component restricted to a lambda light chain, along with additional minor criteria such as ascites, hypogonadism, and edema. Although some diagnostic criteria were not fully met, imaging and biopsy findings were consistent with a solitary plasmacytoma, confirming the POEMS syndrome.
